content:
I think the most challenging part of my transition will be finding a job in my field and adjusting to the Canadian work culture. I've heard that it can be competitive, and I'm worried that my international experience and credentials might not be recognized. I'm also concerned about building a professional network from scratch.

As for resources, I've been exploring the City of Toronto's website and the Toronto Public Library's website. I've also been in touch with some settlement agencies, like the one that's been helping me with my language classes. I've heard about the YMCA's services, but I haven't had a chance to check them out yet.

I've also been thinking about volunteering as a way to gain Canadian work experience and build my network. Do you think that's a good idea? And are there any specific industries or sectors that are in high demand in Toronto?
